Pacitti Company.Body:
Pacitti company are a live art + performance company based at the Think Tank, Ipswich. Their bi-annual SPILL Festival of Performance presents work from artists around the world at multiple venues across the town.

Their mission is to create and curate meaningful interdisciplinary art: Fine Arts, Music, Film, Storytelling, New Technologies, Science, Medicine, Politics, Psychology, History and Philosophy are all vital components of their work.

The Think Tank
A beautiful listed building in the centre of Ipswich, is also available for hire. The space is suitable for conferences, team building, workshops, interviews, meetings, exhibitions, artist residencies, research + development, film screenings and much more. The space can comfortably hold up to 60 people. 

For more information visit pacitticompany.com.

Red Rose Chain.Business Category: Things to Do, Arts & Culture, Entertainment
Red Rose Chain.Body:
Red Rose Chain is a dynamic award-winning theatre company based in Suffolk with a well-established reputation for delivering work for the whole community. Entirely independent and self-sustaining, we create original productions that confront social concerns, often working with overlooked or hard-to-reach groups to create powerful and insightful stories that demand to be told.

Our exciting Community programme provides high-quality and empowering drama projects for young people, hard to reach groups and disadvantaged people in the area of Ipswich, increasing accessibility to the arts. This programme takes place in our new studio theatre The Avenue!

For us, working with the community isn‚Äôt just an add-on thing we do to show we care. It‚Äôs the heart behind all of our work and fuels everything that we do.

Trinity Park.Business Category: Professional Services, Conference Venues, Things to Do, Parks
Trinity Park.Body:
Trinity Park is home to the Suffolk Agricultural Association. Formed as a charity in 1831, the Association‚Äôs main purpose is to advance and promote agriculture and allied industries. This it achieves principally through the Suffolk Show, a two day event which attracts in the region of 80,000 ‚Äì 90,000 visitors from across the region and is recognised as a premier event in the UK.

The Association organises conferences related to farming, horticulture and agriculture and runs a highly regarded education programme. The education programme aims to highlight to children and young people the link between food, farming and the countryside. Such projects include the School Farm Fair, the Suffolk Schools Competition and the Farm Links Project twinning local schools with local farms. To learn more about our education programme contact our Education Officer Hannah Woods.

As the trading subsidiary of the Suffolk Agricultural Association, Trinity Park Events is committed to supporting our local community. As well as helping local charities fundraise for their own special causes, all profits from our commercial activities are ploughed back into supporting the Association‚Äôs charitable programme including conferences and education projects with schools, colleges and universities.

Quay Place.Business Category: Health and Beauty, Well-being, Professional Services, Conference Venues
Quay Place.Body:
Quay Place blends heritage and wellbeing to create a unique venue bringing together old and new, that is welcoming to all.
We offer rooms to meet or host an event, a wide range of complementary therapies, mind body classes, workplace wellbeing, heritage activities and a healthy caf√©.
A place to meet, discover and connect with yourself and others.

The Suffolk Punch Trust.Body:
The Trust is dedicated to preserving the Suffolk Punch breed but also the skills of the people needed to handle these wonderful horses.

Our team of workers and volunteers work hard to achieve the charitable aims of the Trust, to:

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Protect the future of the endangered

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Suffolk Punch breed

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Safeguard Suffolk's unique rural history by conserving native plants and animal breeds

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Offer educational opportunities for people of all ages and backgrounds

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Provide an beautiful open space for everyone to enjoy

With the historic Colony Stud, we inherited a rich legacy of human and equine heritage that deserves to be saved for future generations to enjoy.

Kentwell Hall.Business Category: Things to Do, History and Heritage
Kentwell Hall.Body: Kentwell - a romantic, moated, mellow red brick Tudor mansion in a tranquil parkland setting.

Easton Farm Park.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out
Easton Farm Park.Body: Easton Farm Park was built in the late 1800s and has been a Farm Park since 1974, the second farm park to be opened in the UK. It offers a unique mix of interactive farm fun within a set of listed historic buildings and countryside. Easton Farm Park is the ideal place for family visits, birthday parties, school trips and farm holidays.

Baylham House Rare Breeds Farm.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out
Baylham House Rare Breeds Farm.Body:
Baylham House Rare Breeds Farm is in the middle of the beautiful county of Suffolk in Eastern England and is a small livestock farm breeding farm animals that were once common but are now very rare.

It's a great time to bring your whole family to the farm to meet the piglets, feed the goats and let the kids loose in the play area whilst you settle into the calm surroundings with a piece of homemade cake or a cream tea.

Toothbrush Apartments.Body:
Toothbrush Apartments offers high quality fully furnished serviced apartments in convenient locations around Ipswich.

Just bring your toothbrush!

Suffolk Food Hall.Business Category: Food and Drink, Bakery and Sandwiches, Best of British, Butchers and Delicatessens, Supermarkets and Food Stores, Sweets Chocolate and Desserts, Shopping, Cards and Gifts, Home and Garden, Things to Do, Entertainment
Suffolk Food Hall.Body:
Situated just under the Orwell Bridge in Ipswich we are an easily accessible destination which has diversified to include a purpose built cookery school for workshops, private function rooms for weddings, parties and corporate hire. Our award winning restaurant compliments the local food we sell in the Food Hall and cafe and our brand new bouncy pillow (which is free to use and always will be!)

We run events throughout the year, such as our highly successful Tractor Fair (The last Saturday of August every year). Burger Nights on the third Friday of every month, Quiz nights throughout the year and even Halloween craft parties for the children, amongst other great events. We are linked with various on-site companies who also run their own events throughout the year, all of which can be found on the events tab on our website.

We have two great rooms for hire, which are situated in our restaurant, with great views of the Orwell Bridge and surrounding area. The restaurant can also be booked for bigger events, and events can be tailored for specific needs.

During the festive period we also corporate hamper services, our ready-made and bespoke hampers are ideal for Christmas gifts, and we offer a competent service when completing orders.

The Food Hall will be celebrating its 10 year anniversary in 2017, so it will be a special year for us all.

Greyhound Public House.Business Category: Food and Drink, Bars Clubs and Public Houses
Greyhound Public House.Body:
The Greyhound is a popular Adnams' pub on the outskirts of Ipswich town centre, opposite Christchurch Park and within walking distance of Ipswich Museum, the Wolsey Theatre and Portman Road.

The pub offers a traditional and welcoming environment ‚Äì a great venue to meet friends, celebrate a birthday, host a business lunch or have a quiet drink and relax.

Food boards change daily whilst keeping the infamous ¬£6 weekday lunch, chilli and burgers on the bar menus. There is a small car park and beer garden at the back of the property and free Wi-Fi for customers.

All food is made from fresh ingredients on the premises and The Greyhound also offers a great selection of Adnams real ales, lagers, wines and soft drinks.

Ipswich Arts Association.Business Category: Things to Do, Arts & Culture, Entertainment, History and Heritage
Ipswich Arts Association.Body:
Representing 50+ Arts Organisations in Suffolk
Ipswich Arts Association has 50+ member organisations, which means also that hundreds of individuals are associated with its activities.
In 2017 the Association is continuing a number of successful initiatives including the very popular monthly Ipswich Town Lectures and Concerts, and organising the Classical Stages at the annual Ipswich Music Day event. Members of IAA will be on hand at these and other major events during the year to answer questions or point visitors in the direction of the voluntary arts sector in the area.
IAA also maintain The Ipswich Charter Hangings, which celebrate the towns history and mark the granting of the Royal Charter in 1200AD. They are on display at St Peters Church and continue to attract many visitors.
IAA is also a campaigning organisation and, at a time when there are widespread cuts and challenges, it is raising questions about public resources including libraries, concert venues as well as the quality of arts provision in schools. Many of these topics form the basis for discussion at the  General Meetings held three times a year, in Ipswich, to which anyone is invited- whether or not they are involved with a local society.
The website is one of a number of ways in which IAA aims to keep in touch not only with it‚Äôs members but also with the wider community. It provides an excellent way for societies to publicise their events as well as a diary of proposed events, which has long proved invaluable to those keen to avoid clashes with other events of the same kind or in the same locality.
In addition to helping to promote the work of IAA members, IAA publishes the IAA News & Events brochure, three times a year.  This is circulated to Tourist Information Centres, Libraries and other appropriate public places as well as to all member groups.  For more details visit  http://www.ipswich-arts.org.uk

Anglia Karting.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out
Anglia Karting.Body:
Anglia Indoor Kart Racing has been established for more than 26 years. During that time we have earned a reputation for providing the finest high-speed entertainment in the area.

With our indoor racing karts and exhilarating multi-level circuit, we bring the thrills of motorsport to all adrenaline-seekers.

Whether you are looking for a family outing, a child's birthday party, corporate entertainment, a stag or hen party, or to challenge your friends we have an event to suit your needs.

We offer karting from aged 5 and above, with a separate track for 5-7 year olds. Drivers aged 8-15 (and minimum height of 1.27m) can take part in Arrive & Drive, Kids Activity Days or Cadet Club...no previous experience necessary!

Drivers aged 16 and above can compete in individual race events or team challenges as well as Arrive & Drive.

Jimmy's Farm.Business Category: Food and Drink, Best of British, Butchers and Delicatessens, Supermarkets and Food Stores, Tea Houses Coffee Shops and Cafes, Things to Do, Entertainment, Family Days Out
Jimmy's Farm.Body:
At Jimmy's Farm, we produce traditionally reared, expertly matured meat for sale online or directly from our Farm Shop. All of our animals are rare breed, free range and raised to the strictest quality standards, ensuring a delicious final product.

Our herds graze in the beautiful suffolk countryside and are matured slowly using sustainable methods.

We're so happy to realise our original vision and that through the Farm Shop, we can share a taste of the good life.

Arbor House.Business Category: Food and Drink, Bars Clubs and Public Houses, Best of British
Arbor House.Body:
Located a stones throw from the town centre and crown car park The Arbor House is well located as a place to go after shopping in town, touring the museum, walking in the park or heading to the theatre.

Ideal for a quick drink, bite to eat or something more substantial with a unique menu of small plates which are ideal for snack, sharing or a meal, burgers and mains which are updated regularly. Sundays offer a traditional roast dinner with a choice of two meats and a vegetarian alternative. All food at The Arbor House is prepared fresh using local ingredients where possible.

At The Arbor House you will find a selection of craft, local and world beers both on draft and in bottles alongside a rounded wine offering and spirit selection.

There is also a beer garden, free WiFi for customers, a room available for private hire and we welcome all the family including dogs!

After opening in 2016 The Arbor House was nominated in their first year for 2 Casual Dining Awards.

Empire Cinema.Body:
WELCOME TO EMPIRE CINEMAS

"We‚Äôre Empire Cinemas, the leading independent cinema chain in the UK. Since we launched in 2005, we‚Äôve been a leading innovator in the cinema sector. Our innovation, service and expertise are at the heart of what we do."

Empire Cinema can be found on the 1st floor of the Buttermarket Shopping Centre, with 14 mind-blowing screens, luxury seating as standard and Luxury Recliners for extra comfort or a 2-seater sofa to snuggle up with your date.

The cinema also features two IMPACT¬Æ screens, boasting bigger wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling screens and Dolby ATMOS sound alongside stadium seating and extra legroom, creating the ultimate viewing experience alongside two D-Box suites.  

For additional information and to book tickets please visit:
http://www.empirecinemas.co.uk/ipswich

FREE PARKING FOR CINEMA CUSTOMERS FROM 4PM DAILY - just hand in your parking Buttermarket parking token the Cinema staff on your way out. 

REGULAR MONEY-SAVING OFFERS - visit the offers page for the latest deals on Empire Cinema tickets:
https://www.allaboutipswich.co...

Pentahotel.Body:
Ideal location only 5 minute walk from Ipswich Train Station, pentahotel Ipswich really is the perfect base for a relaxing stay, business meeting or conference as well as being a great launch pad for exploring loads of many local attractions or historic nearby towns like Colchester or Felixstowe.

Just minutes on foot from Ipswich Town Football Club and Ipswich Town centre as well as the award-winning Waterfront Marina and its busy bars and restaurants.

Ottoman Restaurant.Body:
Ottoman offers the finest authentic Turkish cuisine, invites you to delve into succulent dishes and venture into new realms of flavour.

The rich and diverse choices from our expansive menu come all the way from Anatolia, and promise a truly traditional experience.

The name ottoman comes from an empire founded in 1299 by Oghuz Turks under Osman I in north-western Anatolia, a province in what is now known as Turkey.

Suffolk Archaeology CIC.Business Category: Things to Do, History and Heritage

Ohh Deer.Body:
Selling quirky illustrated gifts, Ohh Deer is an online store that works with over 100 illustrators globally to create fresh stationery, homewares, cards and gifts. 

They started to stock some of their products in high-street shops like Paperchase, John Lewis and Urban Outfitters before opening their first store in Loughborough. Ipswich is the brand's second physical store to open, picked as it's the hometown for one of the Ohh Deer's founders.

Beer & Co.Business Category: Food and Drink, Bars Clubs and Public Houses, Things to Do, Entertainment, Nightlife
Beer & Co.Body:
Beer & Co. are creators of specialist food & drink festivals, celebrations and events - with a passion for craft and quality, operating on the principles of outstanding service and customer satisfaction.
Beer & Co. supports their Suffolk roots and also sources specialist bottled beers, wines and spirits of the highest quality from around the world.

Ufford Park Woodbridge Hotel, Golf and S.Business Category: Health and Beauty, Well-being, Places to Stay, Hotels
Ufford Park Woodbridge Hotel, Golf and S.Body:
Ufford Park is a 90-bedroom hotel and offers a fantastic array of facilities for the whole family to enjoy.

The Park Restaurant and Bar offers a seasonally-changing bar snack menu and Little Adventurer‚Äôs children‚Äôs menu. Everyone is welcome, whether staying at the hotel or visiting for the day.
The hotel provides the perfect golfers paradise with an award-winning 18-hole, par 71 course and due to the naturally free draining characteristics, combined with a team of dedicated green keepers, the
course is playable no matter what the weather. 2016 saw a new addition to Ufford Park with a new,18-hole adventure golf course built ‚Äì Congo Rapids: Lost World which is perfect fun for the whole family.
Those of you that prefer time to chill; the Thermal Suite Spa is the perfect choice to wind down after a busy day. With many highly-trained beauty therapists onsite, there is an extensive list of treatments to choose from, you will be spoilt for choice! The 15-metre swimming pool is perfect for a gentle swim and is open to residents and non-residents. You can also visit the traditional sauna, steam room or spa bath on poolside.
Ufford Park really does have something for everyone. It really is a one-stop destination hotel that prides itself on being ‚ÄòThe Gateway to Suffolk‚Äôs Heritage Coast‚Äô.

The Giraffe House.Body:
Staying at The Giraffe House gives you a private and stylish base in Ipswich in which to relax and unwind after a day‚Äôs work or sightseeing. Facilities include a twin/double bedroom, bathroom, living room with sofabed and well-equipped kitchen, garden, courtyard for bicycles, and drive with two off-road car parking spaces. There‚Äôs underfloor heating throughout, and efficient insulation ensuring that the house is warm in winter and soundproofed all year round.

 The Giraffe House is within easy walking distance of the town centre, waterfront, University of Suffolk, theatres and cinema, restaurants and shops.

"I can't recommend The Giraffe House highly enough! Very well-appointed, located and thought out. Very comfy bed, powerful shower and loads of space. Perfect for a solo traveller or couple. Especially glorious in the Ipswich sunshine!"  - Becky, April 2017

‚ÄúOne of the best air bnbs I‚Äôve stayed in. Cathy was so accommodating and the house was clean, light and airy and very comfortable.‚Äù ‚Äì Alice, July 2018

The Best Western Ipswich Hotel.Body:
Welcome to the Best Western Ipswich Hotel, perched on the outskirts of Ipswich with easy access to the town centre and major routes.

Boasting a 4 star rating and 76 fabulous en-suite bedrooms with a recent refurbishment to 48 of our bedrooms and front entrance, a public bar and restaurant with a traditional English cuisine served on a daily basis from 12 noon to 9.15pm.

We also offer afternoon teas from 2.00pm to 5.00pm daily with sandwiches, cakes, scones and cream and a choice of teas and coffees.

We have a lovely lawned walled garden to the rear of the hotel joined to the Wolsey Restaurant which is ideal for weddings, parties and BBQ's.

The Suffolk suite is the largest banqueting suite in a hotel in Suffolk, all self contained with own front entrance, clock room, toilets, bar and car parking for up to 350 cars. We can cater for a seated banquet up to 350 covers and a meeting up to 500 in a theatre style.

We offer free WI-FI throughout all the bedrooms, public areas and meeting rooms free of charge.

Ipswich Hotel also boasts a further 5 conference rooms perfect for hosting a range of meetings..

Inspire Suffolk.Business Category: Professional Services, Education and Skills, Things to Do, Sport and Leisure
Inspire Suffolk.Body:
Inspire Suffolk is a charity supporting young people onto a positive future. Each day, Inspire Suffolk works at the forefront of helping young people to overcome challenges onto positive next steps in their lives back into employment and further training. We work hard to provide young people the chance to take part in motivational education programmes and sporting activities.

Find out more about the work we do with young people here https://inspiresuffolk.org.uk/

I Can Run Club.Body:
I Can Run Club is a unique women only running group. We believe that all woman - regardless of their size, shape, ability or background should have the opportunity to run and progress with like-minded women.

We have beginners programmes in Ipswich, Felixstowe and Debenham, Suffolk, UK. and use our beautiful local parks and green spaces to meet. Our beginners have an exclusive run/walk 6 week programme to follow and a shiny medal to take home at the end! These sessions are suitable for absolute beginners, for those who haven't exercised for many years and for those who need a confidence boost to get out and exercise.

We are committed to making sure you have a safe, comfortable time with us during the six weeks of a beginners session too. We totally understand how hard it is to get out the front door sometimes and how easy it is to make excuses. We‚Äôve all been there too. Have you tried couch to 5k and given up? Have you looked at couch to 5k and thought it looked too much? Do you worry about activity after years of inactivity? Have you had a negative experience whist exercising? Do you think the front door is your biggest hurdle? Do you just want to get outside and move around?

Come and join us! We also have a women only tribe who run on a Tuesday evening in Ipswich. This group run is for those who have completed our beginners programme and those who can comfortably run or run/walk 5k.

Holistic Yoga Centre - Yoga & Pilates Pl.Body:
We are a Yoga and Pilates Studio based in Ipswich run by Srijana and Rod.

We are located in a parade of shops situated in Cliff Lane, Ipswich, just one mile from the waterfront.

We provide various Yoga and Pilates group classes as well as Relaxation and Meditation sessions.

And we specialise in small groups, one, two or three people at a time, so consequently we are able to offer sessions to suit individual needs and times as required.

Please see programmes and classes we provide.

¬†

Opening times are varied. Appointments and visits need to be arranged before attending the Studio.¬†

We are open from 9am to 8pm everyday for phone and e-mail enquiries.

We can provide one to one and small groups classes outside of our regular timetable, i.e. weekends, early morning and bank holidays.

Mollett's Farm.Body:
Spend a few days in Suffolk on our farm, staying in one of our six new luxury cottages and studios, or bring the camper and pitch up on one of our five spots.

You‚Äôll be in the grassy fields of our small farm, and an easy drive to Aldeburgh, Snape, Southwold, Woodbridge and Framlingham.

Innocence Rooms West.Body:
Innocence Rooms luxury boutique accommodation offered at two properties positioned about 2 miles to the east and west of Ipswich town centre.

Our properties offer luxury accommodation in Ipswich at a lower cost than most discount hotels. Innocence Rooms provides a new accommodation concept for the discerning traveller.

Innocence Rooms properties offers luxury accommodation with free Wi-Fi access. Both boutique guest houses are a 5-minute drive from the historic waterfront area. 

At Innocence Rooms West, four of the six rooms have their own stylish bathroom. The other two rooms share a bathroom, which is a couple of steps from each room's doorway. 

Alternatively there is Innocence Rooms East. The elegant rooms are individually decorated and all 6 rooms at Innocence Rooms East are en-suite.

All rooms at both properties offer complimentary toiletries and a hairdryer. All rooms have their own flat-screen TV with a wide selection of channels.

Innocence Rooms is a 15-minute drive from the coast and ferry terminals at Felixstowe. Free parking is available at both properties, with CCTV at Innocence Rooms East.

Ipswich Film Theatre.Body:
Ipswich Film Theatre Trust is a community-based two screen cinema situated within the Corn Exchange in King Street, Ipswich.

IFT specialises in independent and world cinema. It presents films for people who are looking for something different from the mainstream Hollywood/multiplex experience.

Superbowl UK.Business Category: Things to Do, Entertainment, Family Days Out, Nightlife, Sport and Leisure
Superbowl UK.Body: Superbowl UK offers a concourse for players of all ability levels. We are proud to host 12 state of the art lanes. The latest scoring system along with bumpers and ramps are provided to make ten-pin bowling more enjoyable and engaging than ever.

Ipswich Escape Rooms.Body: Looking for something different to do in Ipswich? Then this is it. In teams of 2-6 you have 60 minutes to escape a locked room using only the power of your brain. Take part in the latest craze to hit the UK and the number one rated fun thing to do in Ipswich. The question is, do you have what it takes to escape?

Glow Clinic.Body:
Welcome to Glow Clinic...


Founded by Sue Adams, owner and director of Image Beauty Salon, creating Glow Clinic is a natural progression, and a new direction, for Sue to continue her dream of delivering the best possible service and high-end treatments to her clients. She noticed a gap in the market for an Aesthetics clinic that provided a host of results-driven treatments under one roof and has created a fantastic space right in the heart of Ipswich. 

With a beautifully fresh and zen atmosphere; the treatment rooms at Glow Clinic have been thoughtfully designed to make you feel calm and relaxed during your treatments, so you can leave feeling gorgeous and confident.

The treatments we provide are;

  • Microblading
  • Semi Permanent make up
  • Caci Ultimate Facials
  • 3D Lipo
  • Laser Hair Removal
  • Environ facial products
  • FREE consultations

Shearwater Sailing School.Business Category: Things to Do, Sport and Leisure
Shearwater Sailing School.Body:
Shearwater Sailing School has been a family run school for the past 7 years, providing a quality learning experience while having fun and meeting other likeminded people. 

Sailing on the picturesque River Orwell all year round we have a wonderful home sailing ground. However for those who wish to go further we can set sail to France, Belgium and Holland as well as sailing up and down the East coast of the UK. 

We definitely have something for everyone. Whether you are a newcomer to the sailing scene or a salty sea dog just needing that sailing fix, our Skilled RYA Yachtmaster Instructors are always there to give advice or teach you the new skills you need to make this hobby ‚Äúa Passion for Sailing and Adventure‚Äù. From Start Yachting Courses getting you out on the water for the first time where you  will be learning the ropes, to training Yachtmasters with the necessary skills to navigate their way around the world. 

If you wish for something more chilled then why not hire the boat and her skipper to sail you and friends down the river in the evening, enjoying the sunset on a summers evening with a sail and dine with glass of wine ?

We also offer Own Boat Tuition if you a lucky enough to have your own craft. Plus to keep you going through the winter we run Day Skipper and Yachtmaster theory classes as well as our VHF, First Aid and Radar courses.

Neptune Sailing.Business Category: Things to Do, Sport and Leisure
Neptune Sailing.Body:
Neptune Sailing has been part of Suffolk Water Sports Association and is a Recognised Training Centre for the RYA. It has been working with Neptune Youth Group and those keen to learn to sail in the local community for many years. 

The Centre has been divested from SWSA to Neptune Sailing Management Committee. It has been awarded charitable status. In our first year of operation the centre has worked with students from Chelmondiston, Shotley and Holbrook Primary Schools and aims to extend it's work more fully with the local community. We have strong links with the Scouts and with students from Otley College.

The Centre has a modern teaching building, constructed about three years ago, together with a purpose-built workshop, which was added more recently. Changing facilties are available on site.

Neptune Sailing has worked closely with Royal Harwich Yacht Club for some years, providing youth training weeks for members. It has close links with Woolverstone Project, which provides opportunities to sail for those with a range of disabilities. Both relationships will be developed further.

The Centre has a wide range of craft, both dinghies and powerboats. Access to the water is provided by Marina Developments and our Wayfarer dinghies are moored in the marina with easy access.

Photos by Anthony Cullen, hwww.photographicday.com

Lodge Farm Dairies.Body:
Outstanding self-catering in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, beautifully restored dairy buildings for 2 to 12 guests.

At the end of a mile-long private road, nestled in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, Lodge Farm‚Äôs three luxurious self-catering cottages provide the perfect setting for a truly memorable getaway. Set in undulating Suffolk pastureland on a 300-acre mixed farm, these Arts & Crafts dairy buildings have been beautifully restored and ingeniously designed to offer three independent, sound-proofed cottages that can be interconnected if desired.

  • Home-from-home stylish luxury in a gloriously tranquil setting
  • Close-to-hand activities, including walking, cycling and water sports
  • Individual privacy for 2, 4 or 6 people with the option of communal sharing for up to 12
  • Just over an hour from London and 4 miles from historic Ipswich

Lodge Farm  sleeps 12
An ideal venue for larger family groups or friends to congregate and consists of three interconnected holiday cottages, 

The Dairy  sleeps 6
A fantastic, refurbished holiday cottage with three double bedrooms, ample living space and its own private decked terrace.

The Parlour  sleeps 4
A stunning retreat, contemporary with modern and eco luxuries complemented by spectacular views across rolling pasture grazed by pedigree Red Poll cattle and horses.

The Buttery  sleeps 2
A couple's getaway, the Buttery is furnished to the same high standard.  A mezzanine bedroom with en suite shower room looks down on the double height snug area.

Photographic Day.Body:
Set in the beautiful surrounds of Pin Mill, Suffolk, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, Photographic Day provides a range of colour and black & white photography courses covering digital photography, compact ‚Äòpoint and shoot‚Äô, bridge and DSLR cameras.

A Photographic Day photography course will teach you the techniques of photography, digital imaging and printing to help you create beautiful, impactful images. Each course is limited to 6 people to give you the best opportunity for personal advice and tuition to develop your individual style.

The days are hosted by Anthony Cullen, The Observer/Hodge award-winning photographer and university guest lecturer with over 25 years experience in the editorial and advertising business.

Courses include:

  • Beginner and intermediate group courses once a month, 
  • Photoshop and portrait courses every three months
  • 1-to-1 sessions covering all aspects of photography on a day that suits you.
  • Evening classes in the summer months.

For more information please email - anthony@photographicday.com

Shotley Point Yacht Club.Business Category: Things to Do, Sport and Leisure
Shotley Point Yacht Club.Body:
Based at Shotley Marina by the confluence of the Rivers Stour and Orwell, Shotley Point Yacht Club welcomes all boaters to join our friendly club where you will find like-minded people with an interest in Cruising the East Coast and beyond.

To encourage membership, we keep our fees very low (only ¬£65 to Join, covers two adults and any children of the family, and ¬£50 pa. there after); adopt a friendly, unstuffy and informal approach to cruising life, putting all our efforts into organising and running a full and varied programme of cruising, social and training events each year.

Our cruising events are designed so that most boat owning members can participate if they wish. Cruises are mainly to the many destinations around the East Coast and Thames Estuary, not involving long sails and so are ideal for family boaters, although there are usually one or two trips to Holland, Belgium or France each year. The emphasis is on the social side of things, a glass or two of wine aboard, yacht club meals and BBQ‚Äôs often feature.

If you're interested in becoming a member, please email membership@shotleypyc.org

Nomad Sea Kayaking.Business Category: Things to Do, Sport and Leisure
Nomad Sea Kayaking.Body:
Whatever you''re looking for; tranquillity, adventure, exercise, solitude, skills, nature or to just find yourself spiritually. Embrace the elements with professionally guided tours and courses with NOMAD Sea Kayaking.

From day tours to a wild seal colony, night trips through Harwich harbour or wild camping on deserted beaches with a wood fire, you'll find good company and unforgettable experiences.

Develop new skills starting from a complete beginner to intermediate and advanced sea kayaking levels following a step by step approach. The team teach the basics and build on these skills through a sequence of courses and trips along the Deben and Orwell Rivers and along the Suffolk and Essex coast.

Seal Colony Tours
Harwich Harbour, launching from Dovercourt Beach; click to find out more.

Discover Kayaking Day Trip
Orwell Estuary, launching from Harwich; click to find out more.

Wild Glamping & Kayaking Trip
Bawdsey Quay, launching from Bawdsey Beach; click to find out more.

Kayaking Courses
Whether you're a first-time kayaker or more seasoned kayaker looking for more experience and training, discover Nomad's range of Kayaking courses; click to find out more.

Harwich Harbour Ferry.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out, History and Heritage
Harwich Harbour Ferry.Body:
Foot and bicycle ferry connecting Suffolk and Essex since 1912 

Where the rivers Stour and Orwell meet, Harwich Harbour separates Harwich on the Essex side and Shotley and Felixstowe on the Suffolk side. The ferry service runs throughout the summer months providing a frequent service for tourists to East Anglia, for those with business between the ports and for the convenience of local people.

The harbour area is very popular with visitors who particularly enjoy the beautiful scenery along the River Stour and River Orwell. There are many footpaths and cycle tracks along the riversides and birdwatchers are well catered for with feeding waders on extensive mudflats on both rivers and three reserves within easy reach.

The Pier at Harwich.Body:
With Harwich being so easily accessible by road, train and boat; The Pier is perfectly situated on the quay in the heart of the old town. 

The brasserie is located on the first floor, and is open from 12 noon every day until 9.30 pm and there‚Äôs no need to book which is very useful if you are arriving by water. The menu celebrates modern classics and wonderful fresh fish and shellfish landed on The Pier‚Äôs doorstep. With estuary views from every table, The Pier, only a stone‚Äôs throw from the confluence of the Stour and Orwell estuaries is a very special destination for lovers of great food and drink.

The harbour wall is only 20 metres from the door and The Pier‚Äôs first floor balcony overlooks the water, ships and working docks at Felixstowe and when the sun is shining and the wind in the right quarter there can be no better place to enjoy lunch or dinner.

The NAVY√ÑRD Bar on the ground floor is adjacent to the working harbour, the ideal place for fun and relaxation and is fast becoming famous for the Gin Library of over 130 gins (and growing). The NAVY√ÑRD is open from 9.00am for coffee, breakfast and sm√∂rg√•sbord open sandwiches (there‚Äôs usually a special on the bar too, such as millionaires‚Äô shortbread).

To complete the picture, The Pier has 14 bedrooms many of which have fine views
over the estuaries which means you can stay and enjoy the beautiful sunsets and
breakfast in the morning!

Suffolk Coast & Heaths AONB.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out, History and Heritage, Sport and Leisure
Suffolk Coast & Heaths AONB.Body:
The Suffolk Coast & Heaths Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) is an outstanding landscape along the Suffolk and north Essex coast, including the wildlife-rich estuaries of the Stour and Orwell that frame the Shotley peninsula.

Harwich Haven is the best natural harbour on the east coast of England. The very first English settlers to colonise America left Ipswich aboard the ‚ÄòGodspeed‚Äô and the ‚ÄòDiscovery‚Äô with Captain Bartholomew Gosnold in 1607, saying farewell to Suffolk from the river Orwell.

The AONB is 155 square miles of tranquil and unspoilt landscape, considered valuable of being conserved and enhanced for future generations. Within the southern part of the AONB the Shotley peninsula is important for it‚Äôs wildlife and vistas, and is an area celebrated by artists, poets and writers.

The Stour and Orwell estuaries contain mudflats and saltmarsh which are a haven for wading birds. Every autumn 40,000 wildfowl and wading birds make an incredible journey to feed and roost here. Migrating birds, such as sandpiper and greenshank, are present in spring and autumn. Drainage dykes inland of the river walls provide a vital habitat for insects, including the Emperor Dragonfly, the largest in the UK.

For those interested in walking and exploring AONB Walk and Cycle Explorers can be downloaded for free from www.suffolkcoastandheaths.org/publications. The long-distant walk route ‚Äì the Stour & Orwell Walk ‚Äì is a 42-mile route from Manningtree, around the peninsula via Shotley, to Wherstead and then onwards to Felixstowe.

Nancy Blackett.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out, History and Heritage, Sport and Leisure
Nancy Blackett.Body:
Nancy Blackett is a familiar sight, sailing on the River Orwell, the favourite yacht of author Arthur Ransome. 

‚ÄòSwallows and Amazons‚Äô author Arthur Ransome bought her when he moved to this area in 1935. Nancy Blackett provided him with inspiration for one of his best books, We Didn‚Äôt Mean to Go to Sea. It starts here on the Shotley Peninsula at Pin Mill ‚Äì ‚Äúdown the deep green lane that ended in the river itself… this happy place where almost everyone  wore sea-boots‚Äù.  The four children, the ‚ÄòSwallows‚Äô, help to moor up a yacht, the Goblin, remarkably similar to the Nancy Blackett, and soon they are off sailing her down the river and mooring off Shotley Pier for the night.

Nancy Blackett was rediscovered, damaged and derelict, in Scarborough Harbour in the 1980s. She was brought back here, to Fox‚Äôs marina, and carefully restored to the condition Ransome and the children in his book would have recognised.

Now she is owned by the Nancy Blackett Trust, which preserves and maintains her, and keeps her sailing for the benefit of all Ransome fans. Her sailing is undertaken with qualified volunteer skippers, with a mix of pre-planned programme and odd days, which members (anyone can become a member) can book for daysails or short trips. She is now berthed at Woolverstone Marina, Woolverstone, Ipswich.

You can also enjoy the Arthur Ransome Trail, with geocaches, which follows the Goblin‚Äôs course alongside the Orwell from Pin Mill to Shotley Pier, and our exhibition of Arthur Ransome‚Äôs ‚ÄòSelina King ‚Äò photos at the Pin Mill Studio.

The Pin Mill Studio.Business Category: Food and Drink, Tea Houses Coffee Shops and Cafes, Shopping, Cards and Gifts, Things to Do, Arts & Culture
The Pin Mill Studio.Body:
The Pin Mill Studio is a beautiful creative space on the banks of the River Orwell next door to the famous Butt and Oyster pub. 

With a cafe overlooking the Pin Mill shoreline, a gallery space with regular exhibitions, studios for workshops and spaces for yoga, language and screenings - The Pin Mill Studio is a wonderful place full of character and creativity. The photographic studio is available for corporate and family photoshoots as well as being the space for photography courses and workshops.

The Studio is also come to The Sunshine Store, a charming gift shop with locally-made homewares, accessories and, of course, ice cream!


Photography courses and services from award-winning photographer Anthony Cullen...
The Pin Mill Studio have a fantastic programme of day photography courses as well as bespoke tuition in a stunning location and with a fully equipped daylight studio. Courses include beginner and intermediate days, studio photography, photoshop, portraiture and individual tuition for students. 

Pin Mill Painting days with local professional artists... 
Spend a day or two on the beautiful Pin Mill shoreline learning to paint and draw with experience and supportive tutors. Giving aspiring artists the opportunity to explore their artist's eye, sketching and painting with professional guidance.

Print workshops with East Coast Print School...
Led by textile designer and experienced teacher Victoria Freeland, these workshops are suitable with all materials being provided. Play with effects and techniques and enjoy the beautiful evolution and happy accident that are the very essence of experimental printmaking. Victoria guides her workshops with plenty of support to help you create exciting and original fine art prints.

Check the website for the latest events and details on the courses: thepinmillstudio.com

Visit Felixstowe.Business Category: Things to Do, Entertainment, Family Days Out, History and Heritage
Visit Felixstowe.Body:
Nestled between the rivers Orwell and Deben, Felixstowe is a bustling Edwardian seaside town with traditional seaside attractions, a spectacular pier and home to the UK's busiest port. 

The north of of the town is home to the quaint fishing and sailing hamlet of Felixstowe Ferry, a true hidden gem of the Suffolk coast. Wander along the banks of the river Deben, hop on the foot ferry for a trip to Bawdsey, grab fish & chips, go crabbing and see how many of the iconic Napoleonic Martello Towers you can spot. 

To the south, there's Landguard Peninsula which is home to Landguard Fort, one of England‚Äôs best preserved coastal defences. There's also Felixstowe Museum, the Nature Reserve and Britain's busiest port; where you can watch the giant container ships arriving and departing.

holidaycottages.co.uk.Body:
Holidaycottages.co.uk offers over 25 holiday cottages across the Suffolk region, including a selection close to the lively town of Ipswich as well as many other popular destinations close by.

Our collection of Ipswich holiday cottages include working farms in the gorgeous Suffolk countryside, dog-friendly accommodation and places to stay all the family will love, thanks to their extra features such as Wi-Fi, spacious gardens and games rooms. Sleeping from 2 up to 8 guests, whether you‚Äôre a couple or a large group of friends, you‚Äôll find the perfect place to stay in Suffolk in our collection of cottages.

Zest.Business Category: Shopping, Books Crafts and Stationary, Budget Charity and Convenience, Cards and Gifts, Clothing
Zest.Body:
Don't let death kill young life

Zest, part of the St Elizabeth Hospice family, is a brand now concept in charity retail.

With a fresh approach to charity shopping to help build support for young adults across East Anglia who need the care of St Elizabeth Hospice, Zest not only looks to support young adults living with progressive and terminal illness, but also to engage other young adults in helping provide that support.

To fundraise for Zest, contact fundraising@stelizabethhospice.org.uk
To volunteer for Zest, contact volunteer@wearezest.org.uk

Shotley Vineyard.Business Category: Food and Drink, Best of British, Things to Do
Shotley Vineyard.Body:
The Shotley Vineyard is in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) overlooking both the river Orwell and the river Stour.

The vineyard hadn't been tended for a few years. The winter pruning commenced in January 2018 in readiness for a 2018 crop. Bacchus grapes which have been given the accolade of the Sauvignon Blanc of the UK are being grown, as well as Pinot Noir and Chardonnay for a sparkling wine. 

Please check our Facebook page or Instagram for news and events. 

We will be hosting vineyard tours and wine tasting.

Newton Hall Equitation Ltd.Business Category: Things to Do, Family Days Out
Newton Hall Equitation Ltd.Body:
Newton Hall Equitation offers beginner, novice, intermediate and advanced horse riding lessons for all ages including specialist lessons for those returning to ride after a break. We have weekend pony clubs for children and a riding club for adults. In addition we cater for children‚Äôs birthday parties, corporate events, riding courses and competitions.

We offer vouchers all year round as a fantastic gift idea.

Our newly opened Gallery Kitchen caf√© serves quality food, refreshments, coffee and cake for all riders and spectators.

Briarbank.Business Category: Food and Drink, Bars Clubs and Public Houses, Best of British, Things to Do, Nightlife
Briarbank.Body:
TAP INTO A WARM WELCOME AT BRIARBANK

When you‚Äôre looking for a great beer experience in Ipswich, look no further than the Briarbank Brewing Company. Set just moments from the historic waterfront in Ipswich, thee award-winning microbrewery and bar was established in May 2013 and has been crafting and serving beers for discerning guests ever since.

Whether you‚Äôre dropping by to sample one of the brewery's year-round classics or seasonal beers, or if you‚Äôd like to book a tour of the brewery, the bar team and master brewer, Robert Lewis-Pyke, are on hand to talk you through the ales that are on offer.

"Always open to experimenting with flavour and technique, we‚Äôve cultivated a great reputation for taste and we‚Äôve won numerous industry accolades, including a silver in the 2017 SIBA East Independent Beer Awards."

"Sharing our passion for experimentation with you, our annual Homebrew Competition is open to all homebrewers ‚Äì whether you‚Äôre brewing from extract or from all-grain."

Love Thy Burger.Body: The idea for Love Thy Burger was born in January 2013, when Burger lover Adem Lacin was left unsatisfied by the quality of burgers available in the UK after a trip to America. Adem and his Father, Murteza, set off on a journey to discover the best burger offers in the World. The journey took them from Eastern Europe all the way to America and along the way they compiled a recipe for the best burgers and a great service style.

Mariners.Business Category: Food and Drink, Best of British, Fine Dining, French
Mariners.Body:
Unique floating restaurant.

Mariners restaurant is a classic brasserie on a renovated 1899 boat with an elegant, wood-lined interior, beautiful views across the waterfront and a classic menu of French classics. One of the most romantic spots in Ipswich.

Their rolling Taste the Season menu is a favourite of Mariners' diners; mouth-watering dishes thoughtfully created with fresh, seasonal ingredients to make the very best food for you to enjoy.

They also have a set lunch, dinner and dessert menu along with an extensive wine collection of delicious wines from all of the French regions and from around the world.

Open for Lunch Tuesday to Saturday - 12-2pm 
Open for Dinner Tuesday to Saturday - 6:30-9:30pm
